A challenging FPS with an intriguing story and a fascinating yet dark setting.

The story itself is both enthralling and gloomy, but not to the point of dreadfulness; it presents its points as swiftly as possible without being too overbearing. However, do pay attention to the dialogue and in-game diaries that are found throughout the game; they have the potential of giving subtle yet deep hints of the explanation of the game's ending. Even paying attention to small details in certain levels would provide deeper insights into the background of the story.

The setting is captivating, and also gives me mixed feelings in a positive way. The setting is based in a unique flying steampunk-themed city, with all kinds of fascinating sights and sounds to experience while travelling through various districts of the flying city. However, as you continue throughout the story, you would begin to see the uglier side of this floating city. So yes, the setting in itself is an interesting mixture of fascination and horror. You would begin to adore yet despise this flying city of wonder.

As for the gameplay, I find the combination of guns and Plasmids to be thrilling indeed. It allows you to defeat your foes in a wide variety of ways, and it does so in a casual yet challenging way. In other words, you are free to use whichever gun-Plasmid combination to progress through the game, instead of relying on a deeply set formula to defeat any particular enemy or event. The gameplay's pace is also light and breezy, allowing the user to choose to waltz around, guns ablazing, or play more cautiously, with the usage of covers, long-ranged weaponry, and defensive Plasmids. However, this is not a stealth game at all. Though, interestingly, the 2nd DLC, "Burial at Sea - Episode 2", has a much more stealth-based gameplay.

Speaking of the DLCs, the "Clash in the Clouds" DLC is both fun and challenging! It is an arena-styled DLC, which means that you would be thrown through waves upon waves of different enemies in various maps. The difficulty of this DLC is rather high, but experienced players would definitely enjoy the fast-paced continuous combat that is present throughout this DLC. The "Blue Ribbon Challenges" system, which encourages players to try different combat techniques, may be challenging or plain annoying to different players, but they are fortunately optional, as the player may choose to entertain or ignore any of these challenges.

As for the "Burial at Sea" DLCs, the stories are expanded from Bioshock 1, so please remember to complete Bioshock 1 first before even attempting to play any of these DLCs! The first episode has a more defensive gameplay feel than Bioshock Infinite's base game, whereas the second episode is much more stealth-based. And both episodes have short but interesting stories to tell. Just remember to evolve your playstyle in this DLC set, and you shall do fine.

Overall, I do think Bioshock Infinite is worth a try, for its story, setting, and gameplay. The story does have a few minor imperfections, as it does leave the player with several questions in the end, but the ending is a complete conclusion of the story and worth pursuing. Just remember to pay attention to the dialogue and diaries within the game, think outside the box a little, and you would be able to appreciate the ending. But above all, do enjoy the journey through this bizarrely captivating game!

Another classic from Irrational Games.  While Infinite is more run-and-gun than its predecessors (mainly Bioshock 1), I never particularly thought of this as a negative; it's just different.  The level design accomodates this kind of gameplay well.  The visual and audio design are beautiful, Elizabeth is unforgettably charming, and the atmosphere--while quite different from Bioshock 1--totally sucks you into this very strange and wondrous place.  

And that ending...oh man.  Few game endings have ever made me stare slack-jawwed at the screen as this one did.  

The game isn't perfect and I believe has some pacing issues and can get pretty repetitive around the middle section, but if you stick with it you're sure to find a lot to enjoy about it.  Be sure to pick up the DLC, too, as it really fleshes out the story, and the production values are just as good as the main game.  

Shame Irrational is no more, but they sure left us with some stellar games to revisit again and again.

This is one of those must play games of a console generation. The story is one that will stick with you for a long while after playing (at least it did for me). While you could just watch someone play it on youtube just to see the story play out, you would be doing yourself a disservice if you did as the gameplay is one of the best parts of the experience. That is what this game was for me; an experience. The storytelling and gameplay elements came together in a way that really stands apart from other narrative focused, and FPS games alike. Talking about it doesn't really do it justice, just grab it on sale and regret not playing it sooner. 

Note: I consider it a must to play the original Bioshock before hand, as well as getting the Burial at Sea dlc for Infinite. Bioshock 1 provides a lot of much needed context to appriciate some of the twists and other references in Infinite, and Burial at Sea ties everything together in a way that makes the story feel complete (at least it did for me). Bioshock 2 is worth playing, however it is not necessary for the story coherence (I.e. you wont be lost if you skip Bioshock 2)

This is one of my favourite all-time games and rounds off the BioShock series really well.

As with previous entries the setting is very unusual, but it is the story and character interaction that is really special and sets this apart from other games in the "FPS" and "Action" genre's. I thought the game builds really well to the ending and ends on a pretty spectacular note. I think this is a game that you need to go into the story blind to get the best out of though.

The combat is good. It's enjoyable enough to play but I wouldn't say is a strength of the game or the series in general. If you played the previous games and liked the combat then you're bound to like this.

Graphically this is a very bright and vibrant game and at times looks beautiful.

All-in-all this is an excellent game that I'd recommend to anyone reading this page. You should definatley try it if you played the previous entries and hadn't gotten around to this. 10/10.

Se ha llevado muchas críticas por su linealidad, pero los BioShock tienden a eso. Se sale del mundo submarino de Rapture para situarse sobre las nubes, en Columbia. Si estás buscando la experiencia de BioShock o BioShock II, permítete conocer un poco antes este impresionante juego, porque tal vez no es lo que estés buscando. En cualquier caso incluye todos los elementos que hicieron grande a estos dos primeros juegazos (más el primero que el segundo, pero esa es otra historia).

El argumento del BioShock Infinite sin duda supera a sus predecesores. Prepárate para una historia que vas a querer rehacer mil veces hasta quedar convencido de que la entiendes. Vas a empatizar con el protagonista y su compañera Elizabeth, y vas a caer rendido ante el impresionante final, que aunque puedas llegar a adivinarlo, sigue siendo increíble.

Si duda un juego para disfrutarlo más de una vez.

《生化奇兵：无限》开场那明丽多彩的惊艳画面深深吸引了我，半小时后用铁钩削掉一个倒霉士兵脑袋的血腥画面才真正告诉我这个游戏的风格本质。
这个游戏有点像《羞辱》。第一人称，右手武器，左手魔法。但鲜艳明丽的画面和没有混乱度要求的射击核心，让本作没有羞辱那种沉闷压抑的氛围。但到了《海葬》第二部时，我仿佛是在重新玩《羞辱》，不过AI智商要比羞辱低多了。（近战攻击未被发现一击就晕，我躲在转角，把引来查看情况的2-3个敌人迅速连续击倒都没触发警报）
玩这个游戏最吸引我的并不是战斗，（虽然战斗也很爽快，多种武器各有特色，但最后还是狙用的最爽。）而是整个故事。一开始，我们是为偿还债务来解救被囚禁的少女，伊丽莎白，她聪明活泼，默契无间（战斗时没弹药了她抛弹药，没血了抛血包，没蓝了抛蓝瓶，就连站在售货机前她都能丢给我些许硬币，从没见到如此合拍的神队友），美丽可爱。起初她只是离开牢笼便欣喜万分，看到有飞往巴黎的飞艇就迫不及待地想登上去。当到达飞艇，却被主人公驶向纽约时，她对主人公的背叛愤怒难当，主人公为追回她而险些坠亡时她又伸出援手。
随着冒险的推进，整个故事和环境背景越发黑暗，而少女也越发坚强。
通关完本体后，《海葬》第一部开头，成年的伊丽莎白尽显女性的优雅和魅力。以第一部生化奇兵为背景的新故事也引人入胜，但真正的高潮是在以伊丽莎白为主角的《海葬》第二部。虽然没玩过生化奇兵第一部，但那个世界的背景设定也是异样的精彩，特色相比《海葬》第一部更为分明。结局时分，伊丽莎白完成使命，挽救了那个世界无数孩童的童年，背景音乐《玫瑰人生》响起，那优美又悲伤的旋律久久难以忘怀。
